name: Nemetius

attributes.attribute: honored at one site on the west bank of the Rhine
connected to Celtic words for “sacred grove,” found also in Nemeton and NemetonA

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: Continental Celtic deity known as Nemetius. Scholars have inferred his divinity from the grammatical structure of his Latinized name. The west bank of the Rhine was the location of one site where Nemetius was worshipped. Nemetius’ name is associated with Celtic terms for “sacred grove,” which can also be found in Nemeton and NemetonA.
